column2: OREGON DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column6: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column10: Wait for the next green light.

column2: 2. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: slow down and enter the intersection.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
4. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column6: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column10: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.

column2: 5. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column6: Keep your vehicle in good condition.

column2: 6. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column6: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 7. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column6: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column10: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

column2: 8. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column6: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column10: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.

column2: 9. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column6: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column8: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.

13. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
14. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column6: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column8: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column8: Drive with caution and be ready to stop
column10: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 16. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
17. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column8: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.

column2: 18. This sign indicates:
column4: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.
column8: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.
column10: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.

column2: 19. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.

column6: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

22. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
23. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right.
column10: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 24. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the right.
column10: slow down and keep well to the left.

column2: 25. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column6: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column8: traffic in the right lane must go straight.

column2: 26. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 27. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
28. Aggressive drivers:
column8: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.

column2: 29. This road sign means:

31. Which of the following may result in an arrest for driving under the influence of intoxicants (DUII)?
column4: An inhalant, such as glue or paint.
column8: A controlled substance, such as prescription medicines or illegal drugs.

column2: 32. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Take a cold shower before driving.
column6: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column10: Stop drinking one hour before driving.

column2: 33. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column6: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 34. Yellow traffic signs:
column6: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 35. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
